Not for serious gamers.

The match engine is absolutely terrible and looks tailored towards new players and kids. SI is dumbing down the ME every year. The ME is harcoded to the extend where you have no control over advanced tactics. The company wants you to play the game the way THEY understand the football, which is old school English style crossing and direct football. I highly doubt their development team's understanding of  modern football and tactics because it is non-existent in the game. 

- You have no control over build up play. The central attacking midfielders keep dropping deep because they hard-coded to do so by the developers. They don't understand the build up play. PERIOD.

- The defensive positioning of your players are hard-coded and depends on your player roles 'in possession' instructions. Seriously? Who came up with this genius idea? So if you want your strikers to drop deep when you don't have possession, you can't assign them 'attack' duty because apparently only support duty strikers drop deep. Is this how teams which use narrow 4-4-2 in real life play? No, they don't. The defensive positioning should be INDEPENDENT of your 'in possession' instructions.

- You can't recreact Sane and Sterling roles because in FM they don't stay wide in the final third. The wide attackers roles are hard-coded to stay inside no matter which role you use, no matter how much space is available out wide. In short, you can't create Man City's tactics. PERIOD.

- All wingbacks are hard-coded to dribble with the ball like dumb brainless non-existent league footballers. You can't recreact majority of wingback roles from real life. 

- You have no control over pressing. No pressing triggers. Pressing is hard-coded to the very basic.

There are so many other issues that you can't take the match engine seriously. The developers don't understand modern football tactics.

Allow me to grant you an insight into SI's employee knowledge on the subject their games are about. I once engaged in a conversation with a developer at SI about FM, and football in general. After some talking about premier league, and me slightly confused, I eventually understood that this developer thought that Tottenham Hotspurs were located in Liverpool. So I posed him the following question: "Then why do they call any matches between Tottenham and Arsenal the 'North London Derby'?" to which he responded that he did not know, but he assured me that Tottenham F.C was located in Liverpool. I had to resort to showing him the borough of Tottenham in London for him to understand that Tottenham Hotspurs is not lovated in Liverpool, but in fact in London.

This will be the last edition of this game series I will ever purchase. In a football management simulator such as this, letting SI and their employees (including the one that responded to this review) tell you various aspects of football, is like having a pervert preach to you about the virtues of sexual absitence. They know nothing, and since the core game has not progressed the slightest in 10 years, it would be a fair assumption that they do not care neither.

Fuck SI, Fuck their beloved "devs" and fuck Charlton Heston while you're at it.

The Best Game Ever

Played FM for many years so I am not new to the series.  This year's version is OK but not as good as previous versions.  They made some good changes, expanded tactics, training, a few little UI things here and there and as always a massive database.  I usually get about 1000+ hrs in each version but in this one I'm only around 300.  
First off, I love the changes to training.  Creating schedules and adjusting them, while time consuming, adds an extra layer and almost takes me back to cm 03/04.  You can really target certain areas in the buildup before matches which I really enjoy.  Second, adding transition options and defensive width is quite helpful with tactics.  Allows for a lot of customization and tinkering with tactics.  
Finally, I think the game runs a bit smoother than previous years.  Or at least it does for me.  Not saying the animation is any better than previous years, I actually think 18 was better, but it seems to glide? along nicely.
After that, I don't have many good things to say about FM19.  
Press conferences, social feeds, team interaction, player interaction are all still brutal.  Press conferences are the same 5-10 questions that you always get asked with the same responses.  Social feeds are just a waste of time because they are the exact same formula, 1 good comment, 1 middling, and 1 negative.  It doesn't matter if they make sense or not, they are just always the same.  Really lazy SI!!!  Team interaction and player interaction are the same since the very beginning.  Same accusations and same retorts that never actually target what you want.  Team is dropping points in the last 10 minutes consistently, team meeting, isn't even an option to mention.  Player makes horrendous mistake that was so stupid it borders on comical and ends up with a 6.3 because of it.  After match conversation when you want to give him the hairdryer treatment, can't mention it.  But these have always been issues that SI has ignored so don't expect it to change anytime soon.  The same can be said for salary, contract conversations as well, and playing time.  It's always nice to have a guy come back from injury and take the hump because he isn't back in the first 11 immediately.
Transfers are also the usual headache.  AI teams will come in with a low ball bid and refuse to offer a realistic amount for your players.  You will identify a youth worth 500k and they will demand 55M pounds.  I found last year to be much better about this but it is really annoying and has been an ongoing problem in the series.
Finally, the actual match.....well.....the less said about that the better.  It is nowhere near as good as previous versions.  Players will not make space or create space for teammates.  In and around the box, just expect to hammer a ball into a defender.  Your guy will not dribble or try to create space.  The guys around him will not make runs or try to make space.  If it is knocked out to the wings, your guy will wait until he is closed down or he will dribble to the nearest defender he can find to hammer it off of his legs.  There are no through balls, lofted balls for strikers to run on to, or balls played low across the face of goal.  It just doesn't happen.  If a ball does flash across the goal, nobody will try for it.  Your striker will sit there and watch it roll by.  Defenders with space and time, the nearest opponent is getting a pie and tea, and they will head it straight to him, knocking his pie and spilling his tea.  Forget controlling it sensibly.  But if he does, whoa, watch out.  He will scream down the wing, surge into space, then, then, then, look for the nearest defender so he can smash the ball into his legs.  I've also found that strikers and wingers like to do the same.  If they are running onto a ball, the minute they get to it, they look to smash it straight at a defenders legs.  I've had strikers turn and run the other direction when they are involved in a two man counter.  The winger took off.  Loads of space for the striker to run into.  Only the two of them.  Then the striker saw a nice shiny 50p on the ground and decided to take off after that.  
I could go on about the decision making flaws that really take a lot of fun out of the game, and for me actually broke the game, but it's late and I've already rambled enough.  And this isn't an I can't win I wish it were easier point of view.  I've actually won the league 2 years in a row, reached the semis of the CL 2 years in a row, and won the FA and league cup twice each.  I'm at the top of the table again in my 3rd year.  I just don't like this years game.  I would really wait until next year and hope SI get their act together before purchasing this game.

I don't buy this franchise every year.. My last purchase was 2016, and I said I will give it a break for some time. So I bought 2019 version, expecting some marginal improvements and changes. Yet, honestly, other than the skins and colours, nothing much changes since 2014-2015. So called the biggest addition "training" setup in the game is nothing new in my opinion and the time you invest in doesn't worth the outcome so many experienced players are already giving that responsibility to assistant managers. The interviews etc. very limited and generic questions and answers. No fun - just waste of time in my opinion. I would like to see some more realistic feeling as to why I am winning one game 4-1 and loose it 1-5 next one in couple of days, with same teams. I would like to understand why a footballer with >17 long shots skill shoots all of them off target. More systematic and detailed approaches on improvement of player skills. More supportive data, and more cause > effect feeling. May be I am asking for too much but despite passing years it is nothing more than updated database with FM2016. May be less bugs.
It is not a bad game, so I still play it but I expect much more hence I say purchase cheaper options, since it doesn't make much difference.

FM2019 is a great addition to the series, one of the better FMs in recent years however....

One word. Brexit. 

i am sure i seen people have problems with Brexit in FM2018, not being able to buy players that they want. issues with work permits Etc. On FM2019 i am in the year 2023, i have just moved to the english prem managing chelsea, i have plently of transfer money, however the game is like NOPE! you are not signing world class talent from outside the U.K. No matter who i try to buy. i know FM likes to simulate real life events, and no matter how much we complain to get Brexit removed it won't happen. It has just ruined the game for me, i don't deem it fun anymore. i like to bring in players from all over the world and it looks like that's almost impossible to do.

And for that i have to get this a negative review. i appreciate the devs making this wonderful series as true to real life as possible, but when they take it just that little bit too far it ruins the fun. it is a video game after all.

I missed a couple of Football Manager to games, due to them being very similar each year. Ok another year another FM review.

Again after a quick browse of the reviews it appears the haters are brigading one of the greatest games ever made and arguably the best football simulator / tycoon game.

A lot of people cry about this game being scripted or random and I can assure you this has been a regular complaint and just comes down to people who don't understand the game and how it works.

I am able to take any team from any league and get them to the champions league. I have done consistently with Barnet, Coventry and Wrexham. I do not use any guides or shortlists and always play with random CA and PA if its available. My main critique has always been the game is far too easy when you understand how it works and I was hoping this would be addressed and in this game steps have definitely been made to address this.

This feels like a big improvement on last year so far with several upgraded and changes that have added to the realism. Here are some of them:

1) Tactics

Love the new tactics creator. Has all the same components as before but allows you to choose from more styles and breaks the tactic up into attack, defence and transition.

As a player who watches the games I really could see my decisions in action and found changing tactics led to visible changes on the pitch.

2) Training

Training feels a lot more hands on. I am yet to see the direct results long term but being able to completely tailor your training routines definitely adds more immersion to the game.

Feels a lot more realistic.

3) Scouting

Again not played enough to get the whole picture but it appears they have fixed OP scouting which has again made the game feel more realistic and increased difficulty.

I could literally scout 100 players and get all there reports in over the next week in old versions, it definitely feels like scouting is more realistic and report cards are staggered depending on your scouting team and network.

My friend says that top regens are also now a lot harder to buy, rather then being able to buy the next Messi for nothing from argentina these players come with a much higher cost or future costs associated with them.

4) Engine

I have noticed some improvements but never really had a major issue with the engine in the previous games personally.

I have noticed the back pass bug hasn't occurred yet. This is when your defender under no pressure passes back to the GK and just passes it out for a corner. Would happen a lot and is incredibly annoying and immersion breaking. 

I have only just started playing and am thoroughly enjoying FM2019 so far. Just feels like I have more control over things and feels more realistic so far.

Will update review as and when I notice improvements or critiques.

Played 5 versions over the last decade with many hours in each, and whilst I will play this one for a couple of hundred, it is by some distance the weakest one I've played. 

Primarily the match engine is embarrassing. A defender, with no other place within 20 yards, will head any ball in the air straight to the opposition for no reason. Goalkeepers will run the opposite direction to a back pass and concede an own goal. Strikers will get confused on a counter attack and jog instead of sprinting. The amount of times the opposition score with their only shot...

Outside of this expect to be spammed with the most pointless information about a 1 star players development to a 1.5 star player in your youth team coming straight to your inbox, meanwhile you have to hunt down information on the Champions League if you are not actively playing in it, even if you subscribe to it!

If you have played any version of the game from the past 10 years you will be familiar with all the press-conference questions and hand that, and many, many other duties over to your staff.

The most fun thing about previous games was signing players, shaping a team and seeing results with the formation you either developed or downloaded. I have developed and downloaded several so far and results are at best inconsistent and at worst comical.

The graphics are either a web browser or a Fallout 2 football mod. 90% of players don't have a photo.

The sounds only exist in matches, and the "ole" chants that fans do for passes when a team is winning by just 1-0 is ridiculous.

The concept of Football Manager is what keeps me coming back, but the reality drives me away quicker and quicker.

*Player has started every league game so far, and every cup game
*Player submits transfer request demanding more first team soccer

uh....what?
*insert jackie chan "what" gif


You cant make this sh*t up, i checked the players happiness tab and it says 
"player is happy with the amount of first team soccer he's getting"


WTFFF

A lot of improvements on last years game and very  much needed. i would recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of football as it is a far superior game to its closest competitor in fifa's career mode with a much more realistic view. This game is absolutely rubbish, tactically its is inept and after a long time playing it, it is clear that the game has a lot of issues with scripting, its feel as though the same things happen time and time again. The issue of scripting goes far beyond just the match engine and can easily be seen in the transfer market too. There is far too little instructions that you can give to your players, and sometimes these instructions appear to have little effect if any at all. The game gets so many things wrong it untrue, some players can't even play positions, that I know for a fact that they can play. The biggest example is Cesar Azpilicueta, who can only play at RB??? Despite being world class for two seasons at CB for Chelsea, they won the title the first season with him in that position. Its actually laughable; they don't put the effort into the graphics and instead put it into the database, that's all well and good but they can't even get that right. My advice would be don't waste your time or money on a game that isn't much different or better to the 2018 game, which has the same issues. Quite simply a lack of development here. We will change the colour of the background add a few little feature and give them sophisticated names to fool people into thinking we have made ground-breaking changes. This game series has had issues with scripting for 2 decades, it feel like its not testing my football knowledge but instead my knowledge of how to bet the match engine, that not football. Perhaps they should call it Match Engine Manager 2019. Don't waste your money! This really is a poor excuse for a football management game, safe to say I will never buy another game from this shambles of a game series. Same old, same old issues and I can't see them ever being rectified, as the game maker are clearly incompetent, lazy and lack football knowledge. Rating players out of 20 is such a rubbish concept and does not even begin to account for the varying degrees of ability in football, not that this really matters because they mess up the player ratings anyway. After considerable time playing it i have un-installed it and shall happily go back to playing FIFA 19 they do not have it perfect either but at least their match engine understands football. Look Foward to the day sport interactive go into administration you money grabbers.

Like many have said about Football Manager 2019, its not really any big improvement on the previous titles. If you look at my Game Library, you can see that i tend to skip 1 or 2 versions of this game at a time, purely because they dont really add/change fix the game enough over the course of 2 versions to warrant a full price buy.
The game itself is ok, lots of cool stuff from the community but the game mechanics are the same and are as broken as the previous titles.
Watching the games are incredibly tilting as whatever you seem to do, no matter how much better your side is, will simply be a rng away from giant killing. The Instant Result seems to negate some of this RNG  thats added to some of the public skins that have been made, but that limits you to actually watching the game after you know the result and you lose a lot of that Football Manager feeling on the touchline.

The graphics for the games hasnt changed at all, its still a simplified mess and has 0 detail as ever version fo the game has had since they added it.
The hierarchy system just adds another aspect to juggle which is ok, but seems very one dimensional. 
Overall, the game is ok, but I could have easily just continued with FM17/16, whichever one i previously had, because it simply hasnt changed enough, none of the areas have been fixed, they simply update the squads and roll it out for another £30, they seriously need a overhaul of this game and take it in a different direction, its getting extremely stale which is a huge shame.
I think I have more satisfaction whirling up my ps1 and playing Premier League Football Manager 2000, cause everything thats added into the game has a great polish and feels like it should be in the game.
There are no two ways to go about it: anybody who is obsessed with football, especially the tactical aspect, needs to get this game, but warning, you WILL be addicted
It's good but the freekicks are kinda OP
shit pure shit waste of money DO NOT BUY

After an okay amount of hours on this game I'd say this is the best version of FM i've ever played. It's fun, realistic, editable and challenging (not so much after a while but yeah). However, this review is for Sports Interactive more than it is to the customers.

The first MAJOR problem is that the online modes are absolutely useless, I've tried unreal internet connection speeds and the game is still super laggy, and as far as I know, everyone's facing the same problem. It's 2019 is it REALLY THAT HARD to have dedicated online servers? who still makes their customers host servers?? I swear if the game cost 100$ but had dedicated online servers i would definetly still buy it.

Another problem is the finance being not realistic, as I knew from some reasearch, if a team with low income is promoted to a high division ( for example; Championship, Premier League) it is given a bulk amount of money to match a point of being the lowest possible yet efficient level of finance for its league. How am I supposed to be in the premier league and have like 6k max wages p/w? also needs more work.

I really hope this reaches sports interactive because it will definetly make the game better if they act on these issues.

I honestly don't understand how this game can be so expensive, especially considering next to nothing has been changed from previous versions. Whilst at times it might be fun, the scripting is unreal and spoils any realism. It isn't user friendly. It's overly restrictive in some area's whilst overly detailed in others. To top it off, it has a truly cancerous community and dev team that don't seem to want to make any fixes or changes to the game.

The match engine is completely broken. If you are going to have 3D view and animation, at least make enough varients that it isn't repetetive. Make idiotic things like 40 yard own goals almost impossible to happen (has happened twice in two different cup finals for me, the odds of that ever happening irl are minute). Tactics make no difference. None. Results seem pre determined before the game has started. Players seem to do the opposite of what you ask. Some games reloading and changing things yields different results, but in most it takes at least 20 games, if not more before you ever get any sort of result. It took me fourty games - yes, FOURTY - to score a single goal in one tie, despite me having comfortably beaten the very same team 2-0 just a week before. One on Ones are broken. 90% of the time they will miss or hit it straight at the keeper. The amount of shots, especially long range ones that are clearly saved by the keepers and magically, every time, clip the crossbar are given as goalkicks instead of corners. Kick off goals are insanely common. Strikers are broken, as is crossing the ball. Your wingers will get 20 goals a season whilst your striker struggles to get 10. Corners and freekicks are the main way to score, and even the worst players deliver a world class free kick 80% of the time. You can never win an appeal for a red card, injuries are far too common.

Too much is wrong. Not worth buying if you have an older version of the game.

The squad dynamics are horrible, the mentoring ineffective, the tactics don't matter, the players want contracts every 3 months as soon as they play well, they demand to leave as soon as a random club bids not even half what they're worth, and even now with all of this, with the new update, the lag makes the game unplayable...

just fix the lag, I don't care about anything else by this point...

his game beta includes some very good assets, with the traditional UI included from all football manager games football manager games. However there are a few minor issues that could be ironed out. For example, some players decide that they are unhappy with the management of the club even when the team's morlale is high, and far too many players hand in transfer requests. Another issue is the camera angles that have been included in this beta. Only a few options available work, however very little changes are made when swapping between each of them. Overall, this beta seems to have been a success ahead of the full game launch, as this new addition within the FM franchise feels like it has the potential to be the best one yet.

So this is my first Football Manager and I can safely say after 400 hours of play that is this not a good game overall. I can't speak for other entries in the series but this game's modeling of real life is absurd in the extreme, both on and off the field. Players get upset when you complement them. They whine that they want to go to a better team then get upset when you try to transfer them. Players are made of paper, they get injured way way too much. I've had players go out for 2 months during a match preview session. Red cards are handed out for nothing and egregious fouls are ignored. Teams you should be crushing blow you away and teams you should get crushed by don't even show up. 

The general impression I get from this game is it's all random. All the player interactions, the stats, the tactics and strategies all mean exactly nothing. You might as well be playing Blood Bowl rolling dice. At least in that game there's no match engine pretending to simulate a result - you know it's all RNG.

I've read that the Football Manager series is one that takes a while to cook. That after 6 months of tweaks and patches the game starts to improve. If that's the case we're not there yet. If you really really want a management game I'd suggest looking elsewhere for now, or maybe even to older versions of the FM series that have their engines fixed already, because right now, FM 19 is just an exercise in random number frustration. There are better RNG heavy games out there.

I've played football management games since the days when they came on cassette tapes.  I've played this franchise since Championship Manager 97-98, and I've played every version intensively.  

Football Manager 2019 is the worst version of the game ever.  There are many reasons for this.  

Firstly, the match engine is terrible, and has been the subject of countless bug reports and complaints on Sports Interactive's Football Manager forums.  One particular annoyance has been the problem of getting players to cross the ball; they will seemingly do anything but.  But it would be wrong to focus on my 'favourite' bug in the game, as there are so many problems with the match engine, and other areas of the game, which explains why, at the time of writing this review, there are more than 20,000 posts on the bugs forum. 

One of the big claims to improvement by SI for this game was the revamped training system.  However, it is shambolic.  The sheer volume of choices, which should be a good thing, becomes an issue when the decisions you make either have no effect, or trigger immediate problems. 

The AI controlling player personalities, driving interactions with players, is simply broken.  One of my favourite examples is a player who was a few months into a five-year contract.  I was given a heads-up that he was unhappy, because he wanted a new contract.  He hadn't asked for a new contract, much less been refused, but was unhappy anyway.  I opened a private chat with him, but the chat was over immediately because his reaction was that he was so pleased I'd come to talk to him, he didn't want a new contract any more.  There are many threads on the forums devoted to the nonsensical and plain silly player interactions, which really mar the game.

Press conferences are the most tedious, pointless aspect of the game.  There is an option for allowing the AM to handle them, but it doesn't matter how good your AM is, he will make a mess of press conferences. 

The much-vaunted dynamics on the game are equally ridiculous, with players showing unhappiness on one screen appearing to be entirely happy on another. 

As a tactics buff, I expected great things when I first saw the new tactics screens on FM19.  However, for all the choices you have, you might as well not bother, because the don't seem to affect matches in the slightest.  It's not just the crossing problem.  Pressing, possession play, marking... it's simply broken.  On a tactic I used, I had instruction for two of my players to man mark specific positions on the opposition teams.  I played many, many matches, and never saw my players make a single attempt to mark those positions; in fact, the opposite seemed to be true, with the opposition players being given huge amounts of time and space. 

The daftness of the game permeates every single element.  After I played a Community Shield match, I got an inbox message stating that my keeper had set a new Community Shield record by keeping one clean sheet, as the previous record had been zero clean sheets.  I paid good money for this game. 

I am not alone in being infuriated by paying for a game which is simply not ready.  Unfortunately, there are limited opportunities to make complaints.  The obvious option in to use the Sports Interactive forums.  However, the level of dissatisfaction over the game being raised on the forums seems to have triggered a policy of moderators silencing complaints, and banning forum users who show any dissent against the full on barrage of positive propaganda being spouted by moderators and developers.  It suggests SI know they got this game badly wrong.  

Personally, I'm so infuriated with the way SI have milked the fans with this poor iteration of the game, which has compounded the problems that surfaced with FM18, after the brilliant FM17, that I will not buy any further iterations.  One bad game is a blip, but two consecutive bug-ridden games, compounded by SI's apparent policy of silencing unhappy paying customers has made me completely lose faith in the company.

Problems with match engine everyone is talking about can be summed up by this:

Post match stats
Man U - 34 Shots, 12 On Target, 52% Posession, 75% Pass completion, 93% Tackles won. 
Spartak Moscow - 9 Shots, 2 on Target, 48% Posession, 65% Pass completion, 84% Tackles won.

Here's how it played out: First half we destroy them. Shot after shot after shot. They cant get near our goal. We take every ball off them. Half time? We've been unlucky. Second half starts. They score 47th minute. 

That's ok though, because we are destroying them, we are basically just sat in their box firing shot after shot, header after header, corner after corner. There's nothing to change.

Minute 70 rolls around. I'm powerless. It's one way traffic and we are peppering them with shots. 

Minute 80 rolls around. What do I change? Do I want to? We are peppering them with shots. Their goalkeeper has got PTSD by this point. He's a nervous wreck. 

Minute 84. We score. Phew. Minute 86. We score. Phew. And we win.

But this is not an irregular occurance. And this is a good moment in a sea of bad. 

You see, sure, I won on this occasion, but there has been many occasion like this where I am sieging them, the shots are on target, the corners are greeted with one of my players headers, they can't even get past the half way line, but I still lose.

And it's that feeling of powerlessness, that despite everything in the game telling you that it is one way traffic, that *IT'S JUST A MATTER OF TIME*, and then it isn't, and they counter attack once and win. 

That's what you see everyone talking about. FM is a puzzle game at heart, but it's a puzzle game where it tells you that you are doing everything correctly, but gives you one thing when you know you should be getting the other. 

The match engine has something fundamentally wrong with it. Loads of people seem to be able to master it after a while, but then it arbitrarily keeps you from winning. It's like they know they messed it up and made it too easy, and so made your ability to score harder than it should be. 

The depth of this game is astonishing, and creating your way of playing football is fantastic, but something is rotten in the state of Football Manager, and it cannot be ignored.

Edit: Since writing this review, I played another game. Man UTD at home. 
Stats-
Man UTD - 34 Shots, 20 on Target
Southampton - 10 shots, 2 on Target
Score - 0-0 draw.

Lukaku alone had a player rating of 8.2, with 10 key headers, but still couldn't score. When your striker has a rating of 8.2 and you have 20 shots on target, your tactics are working. This game is broken.

After playing more than a bit of 19.2 aka the ' first major update' I'm ready to write my review. Unfortunately it's very negative, due to one of the most boring and flawed ME in recent years. The biggest issue is always strikers movement, it's just not there and there's really no difference between DLF on support or AF. Lack of strikers movement obviously has a negative impact on central play and especially playmaker types, as most chances will come from set pieces (corner kicks, free kicks and attacking throw in), long shots (quite effective on this update) and the old far post crosses. Other old issues in other areas (AI squad building, tranfers logic, terrible regen faces/hair) as well as new promising additions (more tactical options, revamped training) become less important when ME is in such state. I want to be optimistic though, the new live beta experiment might prove to be a very good thing for the development of ME if SI is smart enough to listen to the right people. Right now I'm afraid they haven't.

I've been an FM fan since the release of FM 2011. I have played almost every version of the game since then, including the mobile apps. 

I can safely say that FM 2019 is the best version of the game yet. With the new training and tactics systems the game is way more fun to play. I am a Barca fan, and while I have been able to recreate Barca's play-style in earlier versions of the game, it has never been more accurate than in this one. And the best part is that it's really easy to do (Much less fiddling around in menus). The new UI and Game engine upgrades are also worth mentioning as pros. 

The only real con I can think of is that now the game feels a bit easier. While this may be more applealing to casual players and newcomers to the franchise, it reduces the enjoyment for experienced players. I finished my last season winning the treble and all the pre-season trophies without losing a single match in the league (while some of those have been done in real life, it's extremely rare and shouldn't be this easy to attain). The SI team should probably try and address this somehow. Maybe make it harder to get your players to follow your tactics? Create dressing room tension based on your tactical choices? Create some top-level drama from the board regarding your tactics, forcing you to make changes? Something to make the game more dynamic and challenging, please.

It's a great entry into the series that adds a lot of much needed improvements for hardcore fans such as myself, and it's also (in my opinion) the most approachable edition for potential newcomers to the FM community. Definitely worth a purchase if you haven't upgraded in a while or if you're a football fan who has never played FM.

My rating - 9/10

P.S., If you bought FM 18, I won't recommend the upgrade to FM 19 (Although if you do choose to upgrade, you won't hate yourself for it).

Seasonal improvement on the annual update of a great game or another step futher into the ever complex world of micro management of a football club? It's a case of being a bit of both I'm afraid.
While there is no doubt that the game has been tweaked to make the everyday realism mirror the real football world with improved match graphics and the introductions of features such as VAR, there is also a lot more detail to digest before, during and after each game which can make it a real full time job to ensure you take it all on board.
So while the immersion to the management world is undoubtadly immense these further tweaks may turn the casual gamer away, but for me it's time to once again trawl those lower league for a cheap sigining who may transform my mediocre season, as I try and drag a club from the depths to football to the upper tiers of global success.

This is probably the best iteration of Football Manager in a while. If you are the kind of person that only buys FM every 2-4 years, this is the one you have been waiting for.

The last couple of years have seen lots of changes that did not really seem to change the way the game was played. New staff roles, scouting changes - all of it seemingly just in the way. This year they have fleshed a lot of these features out more, and they feel more substantial than when they were introduced.

FM19 is not content with merely tying up loose ends from previous editions! It introduces completely new modules for tactics and training. These are brilliant. Especially the training module, which moves the entire FM experience more towards realism and makes it much more transparent in terms of understanding how it impacts individuals and the team. It is a bit overwhelming, though. Fortunately, an assistant manager can competently lead training for you.

The shake-up in the tactics module also attempts to make this component more legible and logical. It has come a long way since the sliders of yesteryear. Now we can control how our team reacts on and off the ball with much more granularity, which should help players who have not played the game for 1.000 hours already. It also offers a bunch of premade tactical systems that playes can choose as a starting point for their team. They do not guarantee success, but they are a great way to begin.

Seriously, do not buy this game. To preface, I had so much fun with it during the beta, everything was relatively perfect (bar some minor bugs with interactions, but given the complexities and frequency of interactions thats acceptable to me).

And of course, patch 19.1 comes out and the game turns to literal shit. It is now impossible to score goals using strikers, or by creating chances from open play in general. Strikers miss sitters, corners are more likely to score than one on ones, defending is out of your control as your players will all swarm the ball no matter what you tell them to do, and goalkeepers are way too overpowered (will literally save every one on one or shot in the box).

Honestly a shame, because everything not gameplay related is great and the training changes are excellent, but there is literally no use to having better training if when my players become world class strikers, they cannot score and instead go on 15 hour goal droughts.

Before anyone says I havent tried different tactics, trust me I have - I've tried everything, 3 at the back, 4 at the back, 5 at the back, defensive mids, pressing, tiki taka, etc and none of it fixes anything. Just get a 6'7" cb and youll win games from corners, but thats not a fun or rewarding way to play. For reference, I got promoted to the prem and won the FA cup in my first season as blackburn, but ever since halfway thru my second season (with the new patches) I've been having all these issues
Buying players are too easy than it would be in real life ... But still a good game with no doubt.

If I was losing then I would be screaming at the screen rather than writing a review. But thats football manager. Its utter ***** when you're losing, the best game ever made when you win. The rage is only round the corner. 10/10

As a person who played since fm09, this game is, i'll say 3 out of 10. 
beta version's match engine was far better than the one that relesed and fixed.

Seriously, is there a meaning for Tiki-Taka or any other tactics? 
all i could see was FB's cross and striker's header. 

you MUST fix this, otherwise, the game is total disaster.

Massive improvement over 2018. The accumulation of lot's of little touches offer's much better feedback. New Tactic options give a greater feel of control and ability to react in matches. Also makes a good jumping on point for beginners, still a steep learning curve but finally has intergrated tutroials for new players.

man i want it to give good review but,,im taken aback by the training..not because its feature, but with the overall happiness of my player..nothing will please them..even if u put a session a day...they will always be unhappy...the most annoying things is..they are improving..but the happiness overall is out of control to the point of ANNOYING THE **** out of me..i was try to ignored this..but this taken my joy away season after season..

SI should seriously ask themselves whether they are here because they are the only one doing this kind of game or because they have created a geniue good game. 
The only positive point I can find is the training system. It looks really nice. However, all the other parts are a complete mess. This current match engine is the dumbest one I have seen for years. 
-Fullbacks refuse to cross when they are in space and wait for two or three AI players to intercept him. 
-Doesn't matter if you are Ronaldo, Messi, Suarez, Neymar, you STILL MISS one-on-one more times than I could count. 
-You would think that after Guardiola showed Premier League how to play beautiful style. SI would finally try to give possession tactics a bit more ease. But why follow the real world when it doesn't suit you?
-AI goalkeepers are all Superman, like again. AI defenders with 10 speed can outpace 19 speed Dembele, like again. 
-The best way to score as of now is to score from corners but your forward can easily go 10 hours without scoring because no matter how good your front line is, as soon as your oppposition use Ultra-defensive style formation, you can expect them to win by one goal with only one shot. 
-Messi contract in FM is 1.2 million per week but I can't give him a new contract because the highest I can give is 750K. 

But hey, at least we have a new ♥♥♥♥ING purple skin to look at, what a innovation for a whole year. CAN'T WAIT FOR ANOTHER YEAR

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In case someone is missing the point, I'm saying SI is not improving. Their base game is still good but they could do more than just giving me a new UI.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I expected some fan boys to shout "You sucks", but I didn't expect them to just throw random accusations and insults without any sound reasons. Perhaps, this is the reason why SI can get away with♥♥♥♥♥♥like this because they know no matter how bad the design choices are, the community will bash anyone who raise these issues with "You sucks". 
And for these 3 years old who can't understand what my negative review meant, I wished this version to be better than previous 18. The core design of the game is the best one out there, but the current machine engine is so unrealistic, they might as well use the 18 one instead. If you have a whole year to make a newer version, but failed to address the problems in many previous version AND introduced new problems to make the match engine even worse, why shouldn't I dislike about it? If you like it, give a positive review and move on. But shout "Go die" to criticism is just so funny.
BEST GAME EVER

I've played FM from 2010 to 2016. I really enjoyed FM 12 the most, and felt that the quality of the game begane to decline after this version. So I skipped FM17 and FM18, but then tried out the demo for FM19 and really enjoyed it. I thought that nearly every part of the game was fleshed out. The game felt very rich in terms of how much you can do or not by leaving it up to your staff. 

The game has revamped a lot of items to make it feel like I'm part of a bigger world than in previous iterations. I enjoy the training aspect of the game because it groups up the players into units, and I don't have to personally set it up. The dynamics page is neat too because it gives an additional dimension to the relationships my players have with me and one another. There's also just so much data that I can sink into and analyze for my team. 

One con though which is that I hate Brexit =(

This game is such a mixed bag. The depth is ridiculous but my main issue is that nothing really seems to matter when it comes to match days. I decided to manage chelsea.  I made some good trades bringing on john stones and some lesser known players.  My tactics were well known by the players.  Somehow in my preseason matches i dropped four of six matches to MLS teams including a 4-2 loss to New England who absolutely sucks this year.  I would lose matches despite a 26 to 6 shots on goal differential with about half being on target.

Skip to community shield.  Holy hell....four main players missing from Man City's roster including debruyne and their starting goalier and somehow i still lose 2-1.  I dont know wtf is going on with  whatever engine decides who wins and who loses but the stats are absolutely insane.  I doubled every offensive stat for man city yet still lost.

This to me is a huge issue.  While I never expect to win every match, I think when 4 of your starters are out, you should maybe expect a win.  And you never think a top 3 team in the prem is going to get run by Philadelphia and New York.  

My suggestion is buy the editor and just stack your fucking team.  Whatever little engine that decides winners and losers is fucked.  These matches make no sense but ALWAYS lean towards the side you are playing.  Its kinda fucking ridiculous.


Updated...

Match engine still continues to be a pile of shit.  Tell me how you can continue to rack up 20 to 30 shots per match and score maybe one goal while your opponents get under 5 and have the same amount of gooals or more.  Was playing v West Ham and finally had to turn the fking game off.  After drawing v Gent (29 shots to 3), i was already down to west ham 2 - 0 on  2 shots.  Watching Lucas break away from my defense like they were just standing there was unreal....because thats what it is....un fking real.  Your break aways?  dont worry....every opponent has a super goalie or youll shoot wide or hit the bar over and over and over and over again.  Thank god for the editor.  I have to boost my all ready all star played just to have a chance against shit bottom feeder teams.  Well fking done.
cant score any one on one. all goals form free kicks and corners. my central defender is my top goalscorer.

a lot of chance, a lot of shot, no goal
but AI have 1 chance, 1 goal and win again
2018 is the best FM for me.

But with so much in terms of development time and money, I find it technically shameful. How do they manage to have such crappy 3D (look at those avatars, stadiums). I know that is not why people are playing this game, but a good presentation is always needed. Make it sprites if you cannot make 3D.

My love for this game knows nobounds and I've played Football Manager games for 17 years now. Anyone remember CM 00/01? ;) 

FM 19 is a great game. I really like the new tactics and traningsystem, especially the new mentorsystem. The new press conference screen is more fun, even though I tend to let my assistant run the show. 

Also as a fan of the German league, having it fully licensed with pictures and logos is great, no actually it's fantastic. I don't use facepacks or logopacks so for someone like me it makes it really fun when the German league is licensed.

Best football manager so far for this year!

So far not too impressed, and here are 4 reasons why***:

1. Players are ALWAYS unhappy!!! They do not give you a break, more so than the other games. If a player is in rotation and you don't play them for a few games rest assured they will demand to be transfer listed. 

2. Shouts. Do they do anything???? Often they get 'fired up' but will go on to lose 4 - 0. *sigh*

3. Not sure if I am the only one experiencing this, but I get such bad FPS on the 3D gameplay despite my computer having "5 star" 3D capability (16gb ram, GTX 1060 gc, latest processor ect). Why??? 

4. They've overloaded this game so much, everything just seems so slow and glitchy, not nice and smooth like previous games (although I've found this to be the case with many of the recent versions). This game must require some super computer to be able to run nicely. 

***Now obviously I only have a limited amount of hours on this game (8.6) and I will continue to play it. Just expressing my initial thoughts. So far, would not recommend this game.

I don't understand why this happens EVERY DAMN SAVE from FM18 to FM19 I have a team playing really well throughout the first half of the season and then all of a sudden the team decides to start having secret meetings behind my back and decide, "you know since were top of the table rn why don't we just screw coach over and throw every game" because immedietly when it hits the half way mark of the season all my players decide to be crap and lose to teams that are fighting for relegation even if were at the top of the table. I don't understand why it happens in all my saves, if there is some type of algorithm that makes this happen wanna let us know Interactive so that we can be prepared to get screwed over. It really pisses me off.

As far as management games go this is the absolute finest example you could hope to find.
10/10

The best football manger to be released yet. The whole game feels slicker, cleaner and less confusing than other versions. There's been a lot of great new features added and other features smartened up. 

I played around 70 hours in the beta, found a few bugs but all were resolved very quickly. 

If you're looking for a football manger sim then look no further

As of the time of this review, the Pre-Game Editor does not work.

While you *can* set up a league structure in the Basic Editor, as soon as you use the "Advanced Rules", the file will not "Verify" which prevents it being used in game.

This means that the good quality leagues found in previous versions of the game cannot be created and added to the Steam Workshop.

The Editor directs any questions to the "Editors Hideaway" on the Sports Interactive website.  The response here from SI is to ignore all questions and delete any threads that might give an appearance that something is wrong, to give the impression that all issues come down to 'user error'.

With SI not adding any actual content other than to update rosters and tweak the system, it is the variety of fantasy leagues etc. added by the community that seems to bring people back to FM year on year.  Therefore a better response should be expected from SI with regard to issues with the Editor.

Easily the best looking Football Manager game of them all, although I did personally prefer the layout from FM17. The new features may seem daunting to new players (who FM need to attract) but overall it is a vastly improved game.

After a looooong hiatus from FM games thought I'd give it a go to see it will rekindle my old love for it. My experience thus far:

First half of season: lots of wins hovered around 5th, top striker scores 1 out of every 2 games
Second half of the season: lost pretty much every game, top strikers doesn't score for 20 games
Entire season: so much information bombarded my head hurts and a ridiculous amount of injuries

All in all this doesn't feel fun it just feels like a part time job

This is quite possibly the biggest mess of a FM game I've ever seen. I thought the idea of a public beta was to make it less buggy??

The training is now an incomprehesible mess, goalkeepers dive several seconds after the ball has passed them, defenders stand still/ do a crab-dance instead of closing down, there are framerate drops everywhere (Ryzen 7, RX 580 - it's not my hardware), if the game is in full screen it keeps freezing if you have a dual monitor set up, crosses went from being wayyyy overpowered to being pointless, the ball "hits" players and bounces in the wrong direction. 

What the hell SI?! If you can fix these problems then I'll happily change my review, but unless these issues are fixed, DON'T BOTHER UPGRADING FROM FM18!

Liking it and Definitely worth the cash but as a repeat purchaser I'm unsurprised but dissappointed that the player interactions continue to be tedious and non-intuitive.  A player insists on being transferred because he can't get a work permit, and none of my options for explaining it to his mutinous teammates have anything to do with work permits.  Tried "hey i've got registration requirements" as that seemed closest and got "well you reg'd some trash worse than him" as a response.

Creating tactics is less byzantine and the match engine looks good.
FM19 may have it's minor flaws like any game in the first few months of release.. But as it stands it's simply the best FM in the series so far. .Highly enjoyable! 215 hours and countiing!

It's safe to say that this is the best Football Manager ever made.

Having problems starting the game.

It has taken roughly 35hrs per season.  I've got 151 hours in game, minus the times when I left the comp to do other stuff and I'd say 35 is about fair.  That is utterly ridiculous.  You spend so much time watching the dates scroll by, the movement of time is interrupted by so many faffy little messages.  I can't sit down and play this, I need something on in the background or it's just a bloody slog.
The gameplay is actually better, I love the way training is done and I love the tactical depth.  Transfer negotions feel like they have a little more push and pull too, but there's still a lot of really daft demands and people always wanting yearly raises.  The graphics are decent, there's a good variety in what you see and the stadiums aren't too bad either.
I don't know if i can complain with 151hrs in the game, but at the same time, there's a lot lacking.  My main bug is that big teams always hammer me, but the rest is competitive.  That's just not realistic.
This is the best FM has ever been, but it is just far too slow.  And no, I don't want FM Touch, because there's hardly any game there.  On a top end gaming laptop like mine this should be much faster.
So I'm deleting this, I don't want a game that takes 35hrs to run a season, I don't want to have to have a tv show on that I am only half paying attention to because the game I'm playing is so slow.

I'm not going to say it's a bad game, there's a lot of good in this, but man, you need so much spare time to get through it.
By far the best football manager since FM 15.

I'm a FIFA and PES manager mode player. I played that for about 8 years, know almost all the things about them

But when I bought this few weeks ago, it was a life changing for me 

Like seriously, I am not going back to fifa or pes. 

This game puts those two to shame.

Buy it, you won't regret it. It will be hard to understand at the start, so watch some youtube videos, play around with different teams.
And you will get to a point where you realize that you are actually playing this for about 20 hrs straight

HAVE FUN!

Tactics and training looks good but is pretty complicated so takes a bit to get used to. 

Major problems with injuries. I manage 2 teams and both teams have had 4-5 players out 3-4 months and 2 players each out for the season. 

Major problems with match engine - On both teams in my 4 months of management i have scored 10+ own goals against myself and had 5-6 scored for me by the opposition. Which is just as well because your stricker no matter how good they are will miss every single one on one or blaze miles over no matter what the stats. You will also at least once a month have one of your players on the 3d engine pull off a great tackle taking the ball. Get a foul against them have the commentary Say "that didnt look like a foul" then be sent off for "a dangerous two footed challenge" Constantly happens. 

Same issues as previous years teams 2 divisions below you in a cup will have 40 shots against them 30 on  target but you wont see 4 highlights all game and lose 1-0 although this time that goal will 100% be an own goal as per the other issue which makes it even more frustrating. 

Get a refund. Stick to a better older FM its what ill be doing

There used to be a time I spent 200+ hours on each release of FM. Then from v2012 onwards that got less and less, and I felt less and less like I knew what I was doing in the game. When the inevitable slump in form came I had absolutely no idea what to do.

My biggest annoyance of the last years has been resolved: the enormous amount of information has been channeled so it is much easier to understand what is going on. I haven't had that famous turn in performance yet, but my hope and expectation right now is that the information screens I see will also give me ways to turn things around, which I felt really was missing in the last version I gave a good try (v2015 I think). The post-match analysis really helps me now to touch up on my tactic and shows what works and doesn't work.

I am really get back the feeling I used to have from the older FM versions, back when I knew what I was doing!
Good

Good game for fan of Spain dvision and preimir division, but for Serie A team fans, this game is completly trash.
Stupid AI trading logic makes Serie A boring and dumb. Serie A team would never buy famours players even with billion dollars in the pocket, the only thing they knew is loan. I start with Milan, in my 2nd season, Juv had sell Rugani, Costa, Cancelo, De Scigilio and only loaned pauliniho. Now Juv only have 17 players in first squad. 
In my beta version game, same situation. 4th seasons, Inter had sale all the players that worth higher than 30M, but did not buy any famous players, Juv had sale every famous players except Ronaldo. Serie A became extremely boring and that's why I start a new game. But the same thing happens.
This is ridiculors, and it is discrimination to the Serie A teams. DON'T YOU EVER NOTICE the investment of Serie A teams for these years???

Seriously, I would never suggest any Serie A fans buy this game unless they take corrective actions.

So having played this game for a few hours, where I play in 2D with 3D replays, I feel that the games themself feel beter.
Atleast in the 2D part I'm seeing better saves from keepers, better longshots and individuel actions that even once turned into a goal and not into a shot 50 meters wide like everytime in fm18.

Tactics seem to be followed better and changing tacktics really changes how your team plays even if you have the same formation. This could be because for the beta I'm playing as Ajax and with pretty good players it has that effect, can't say if it does for worse teams.

The rest of the game just feels much of the same, training is nice for those who want to go really deep into it, but for now it feels like a part of the game that I really don't want to put 10 hours in, just so the game can tell me I did it all wrong and so have wasted months of players training. So I just keep it on automatic.
There are alot of smaller changes that really make it alot better to play, like the scouting reports, giving contracts to players that don't demand anything (you can get advise on what a good first draft can look like), the game running a bit better, etc. etc. 

Right now it just feels better than fm18 and that is great seeing as I will play this game alot in the coming year. So even the smaller changes make me really happy that they made them. 

Look, it's not a totaly new game and the graphics are not like fifa or PES, but it did make alot of cool little changes and even a few important ones that make this game feel alot better than fm18. So if you liked that one, you will like this one even better.........but who cares? because you already bought it and are playing it for 500 hours or you don't care and just want to hate on it because it has not so great graphics.

Ow and all this is just me playing for a few hours, so things might changes and if they do I will update this............maybe, if I feel like I care enough.

For now, have a nice day.

Edit #1

After playing a bit more here are the other things I have noticed:

not only are the longshots done alot better this year, you can also now score more than in a blue moon from corners and indirect freekicks.

A thing I have to see how it will develop are the injuries. Right now I feel like they ramped them up, but could be just bad luck. If they are ramped up it could be because they are factoring in your players being tired alot more. in FM18 you really did not care about a player being at high risk of injury, but it could be in FM19 you really have to keep an eye on that.
Although it would be nice if you would not get a message after every game that some players are tired........Yes I get it and I will rotate them next game, please stop bugging me to talk with my players about it because they will just get mad at me for it.......

that was it for now, maybe will be back later. (ow, I allowed comments, did not know those are disabled if you do not check the box, so if you feel I got something wrong or right, let me know)

Edit #2 (last edit)

These are my last thoughts about the game:

I did not get any gamebreaking or really bad bugs, just a few weird things with the stats, but I don't care that much about those and those are already fixed with the full release or are easy enough to fix later.

Like I said in the last edit, you really have to look at the injury risk in this game. If injury risk is high than it's better to give that player a rest next game or you really have a high chance of getting a injury of a few weeks atleast, but I find this to be more realistic than it was the other years. Now players will get tired if they have to play 2 matches in one week and the injury risk is a real thing you have to look at, not something that did not matter and did nothing.

So yeah, in my eyes this is one of the best if not the best FM game in years. 

(even though championship manager 4 is still my favorite ........bless you Makofo and Shabalala, your 20 dribble and around 18 pace and speed where OP but so fun)

I've been playing SI football manager games since championship manager 2 on MS DOS (1995) and this is the best version ever. 

The new tactical system is brilliant . Now it feels more than ever that you can watch the game and make intuitive tactical changes easily on the fly to counter your opposition.

I love how this game isn't just about the numbers anymore and how man management can transform your players for better or worse in realistic ways. 

In fact all the small things can change what happens on the pitch.... training, media handling, mentoring groups, friendship groups, languages, transfer pressure etc. there's so much depth to this series now!

I have insane amount of hours on the last few Football Managers and I can truly say that this is probably one of the best releases in the last 5 years. Man managing has been improved and worked on since last years introduction which makes it a lot more enjoyable for those who enjoy squad building. As a keen tactician I absolutely love the new additions to tactics which makes it a lot easier to play to a defined style or play which alongside fixes to the match engine has allowed tactical styles to feel different to one another instead of all counter attacking, possession, longball tactics feeling the same. Training changes are awesome too giving the game a lot more depth in player development, but the biggest change from this is that I feel like you have to rotate your squad and adjust training accordingly instead of sticking to same old routine all year. Very stable and hasnt crashed on me yet which is great for an early release game.

Feels better than the bare minimum data update rubbish of recent years.  It feels much better and the response to the things you do seems to make more sense and feel less like a robotic time wasting exercise in doing stuff just because you know it's better if you do despite the mind numbing tedium. In summary, bearing in mind the crap we've been putting up with this last decade or so with this lot, this is definitely a step in the right direction. I think they knew the writing was on the wall and have tried to improve things and listen to their customers rather then take them for granted, so applause for that, but there's still work to be done.

Remember every bug in the game play? Crosses, One v ones always missing, needing to create 30 chances to score 2 goals while the cpu beats you 3-2 with two shots total? - Yeah well all of that nonsense is still there as it always has been. The engine still needs a tear down and rebuild, but they clearly don't have the balls or the will to do so. Niftier graphical representations of action are not going to solve this. It's time to evolve lads and consign this engine to history imo. You've polished this turd to a shiny gleam, it will not polish much further methinks.

Apparentlhy the injuries were sorted for release. I'm a (game time) month in and i've had ten, TEN! 2.5 a week! We haven't played a competitive game yet, my training intensity is low, and i've been giving the players 45-60 minute run outs. It's bloody bonkers! If this is the injury issue fixed, then you need to look again. 

All in all, at first glance it feels like we're getting there, but i feel like it's just better stuff bolted onto the same old problems tbh, and when i've had a decent amount of time to assess what's what, i'll probably end up hating myself for being such an idiot again and giving my cash to people who probably don't deserve it all things considered. Right now though, i like most of what i see.

What these lot need is some decent competition to give them a proper kick up the arse, but i don't see that happening any time soon tbh. If like me you've been bitterly dissapointed with pretty much every release in the last decade or so, then probably you'll see past the gloss, however, that said, this feels like a much better effort and whilst it won't make up for feeling fleeced by these people over the last decade or more, it's certainly now approaching the game it needs to be. They need to be braver and tackle the match engine though, they really do.
Took Woking from the conference to the premier league in 6 seasons, stuff like that doesn't go unnoticed mate!

Another year, another pile of steaming garbage. I mean who the hell is designing their user interfaces? Seriously? Does their UI designer have any education in design what so ever? Glaring purple? Really?

And the alternative skins that come with it? They haven't even taken the time to make sure the text is properly coloured to pop against the background. I, could literally have done a better job at designing the colour schemes of their user interface. Am I some sort of genius who can do anything? No, I just realise that SHOCK purple is a bad idea to fill your screen with and that the colour of your font should be markedly DIFFERENT than the backgrond!

This really speaks to the level of, or rather lack of level of effort.

The interface itself is worse this year. Less intuitive. Less response. Missclicks are the order of the day for tasks you will repeat countless of times.

At what point are you people going to fire whoevers in charge of UI and hire someone with ANY relevant skillset?

But this is a game all about clicking through menus and reading tons of stats. And it just pains me to try and do that in 2019.

Stop changing things to change them. Make changes based on creating a user friendly experience!

I haven't tried too much of the game yet, but posting my review based on first few hours. I have probably played this series since FM 07, so not a newbie to the game overall. Also note this review as yet, is for the initial beta release (though gameplay doesn't change through editions, so don't expect it would change for beta-final).

1. New Features -
Tactics and training has been overhauled. Overall this "looks" to be a really nice addition. Increase in level of detailing is a nice step too.

2. Tutorials -
Having played every release of this series for over a decade, turned off initial induction module. The new feature induction on the other hand, was pretty annoying. For the polish and overall UX the game gives, this seems very very badly under-designed. Too much text, No way to go back to read again, doesn't sound like great idea. Just play a video reel if navigation is too difficult to code.

3. Match Engine -
Maybe its my tactics or maybe something else. But actual game play is ridiculous. I have had GK miss balls they should be catching in their sleep. Even with high intensity tactics, players would rather die than get into tackles. Track back at corners is ridiculous. In short absolutely no improvement over last year, except perhaps a bit smoother gameplay. 

[UPDATE] : Injuries are frustrating. Even with average workload, I keep on having at least 2-3 injuries per game.


While I completely understand that it might be difficult to add value on every iteration, SI really needs to revamp its match engine which till FM 12-13 was its major asset. If you can't add value to the game there's no need for yearly full releases. Just sell newer databases. UI/UX is always pleasing change, but to be honest its overhyped for it to be the biggest selling point.

It wouldn't be too far otherwise, that FM series will be disrupted just like it did that to CM series a decade ago!

This actually feels like a fresh game. As someone who was not planning on purchasing the game this year once I saw the revamp to training and the tactics system I was happy to give it a try. It adds so much more depth to the game and you feel like you actually have more influence over the team. 

It would be helpful though to start with the option to use the tactic closest to what is used in real life. As someone not adept with knowing what tactics many teams use in real life when I begin as manager I'm asked to set up a tactic. I have selected some then realised that it doesn't suit the players I have so I have to scrap it and try something else. A default option for each team would be handy for less experienced users. 

The medical center needs to monitor minutes played NOT games played. Telling me a player has played 4 games in the past 2 weeks isn't helpful when I know that I have only used the player as a sub for 10 minutes in each of those games. And saying that this player is at an increased injury risk because of this tells me there is some seriously flawed programming. Switch it to minutes played so I can better monitor game time for my players. How this hasen't happened years ago baffles me. 

The ball physics are improved and some nice skills with the ball are added for the players. The highlights are slightly more interesting to watch...though I am sick of still seeing players kicking the ball into the back of players infront of them as if they didn't notice they were there. Sometimes the players act as though they are stuck in mud, a missed penalty that is blocked straight back at the penalty taker and they do not move, there needs to be that reflex action, this happens in other areas too. 
I would have liked to see the press confrences improved as they're just as boring as ever and I'll skip them every time, though they have added more visible response by players. The few that I have taken has left me puzzled by some of the player reactions and even less inclined to ever answer a question. 
I would love to see more interaction with players available, as a manager I would like to be able to talk to players differently based on their personality. Everyone is different and can't always be treated the same, having the option to encourage a player to improve in training without having to first tell them that you're unhappy with their training would be useful as there are too many negative responses when criticising training. 

The social feed is an absolute waste of space, immediately turned off. I don not want or need fake social media in any game I play. How does fake twitter users tweets help in any way? It doesn't add anything to the game except the hassle of turning it all off. Time wasted that should have been used improving other areas, though it seems the same as last year so no wasted time this year really. 

Vast improvemnet and a stepping stone to build upon next year.

TL;DR - Don't be discouraged as a first time FM player.

Would highly recommend this game! If you played previous versions and skipped a few then you need to pick this up!!!

Certainly one of the best iterations of the series in a long time.  Tactics finally feel like they make a real difference, with players actually seeming to implement what you have asked for (at last).  Example: 0-0 at half time in pre-season friendly in a game we are expected to win - we've played ok first half but looking a bit shot shy up front and a bit laborous in the build up.  I tell them at half-time to keep going and the win will come. Instruct the strikers to take the game by the scruff of the neck and make the difference. Ask for a quicker tempo and a more attacking mindset. Ask my best winger to up his game and start  getting in more crosses.  Tell the full backs to push on and support the wingers.  I kid you not - everything I asked for was apparent in the 2nd half - crosses start flying in - 2 goals from my strikers - my best winger much improved.  I shout from the touchline a few times to praise the team - and they seem to up their game with the added encouragement.  Last 15 mins we start to tire and the opposition start to get more of the ball - we are too open now so i stick on a DM and tell them to keep it simple, mark tightly and see the game out.  We win 2-0 and I praise them to the hilt for a great 2nd half.  This isn't just a one off, but it's the best example I can give of you actually feeling like you are making a difference.  I have never felt this in an FM game previously.

I'm in no way a fan-boi and have slated FM somewhat in the past for some piss-poor attempts.  This year though, things are looking very promising.  Training too - oh my lord - it's what I've been looking for for ages, a joy to micro-manage if that's what you want.  Sending your players on team bonding days and for community outreach sessions to build morale etc - superb stuff. Also, the 3D match, while not making huge strides forward, certainly feels far more polished.

If you are in any doubt about purchasing this year, as I was, I can wholeheartedly say that you are safe to take the plunge.  While it may not be perfect - it is certainly far closer to it than ever before.

Coming from someone that buys the game every year and puts in thousands of hours on each version.    I can say that this year's game is one of the best improvements from the prior year's version.    Outside of all of the new features the game runs much smoother overall.    

If I had to pick out one new feature that adds to the game I would say the training system.   I really enjoy setting up training as a team and for each player.  The system makes sense and allows you to add some variety to specialize as needed.      It is still too early to tell as to how may training choices will work out,  but I feel more involved then ever before with the system.

I don't always recommend jumping on the new version at release but this year I would give it a thumbs up.   Get the game now, its worth the full cost.

This will be my fourth game played in the FM series (2015, 2016 and 2018 previously) and I haven't hit the ground running with any of them like I have with FM2019. The new features, the added depth, the new retooled visual design, the graphics, almost everything in this latest installment builds on previous iterations of the franchise.

What a surprisingly awesome release. The training overhaul is the gem of this edition, being able to customize how your team trains for specific matches is brilliant. The stadiums look better as well, and there many other little things that pop out at you. For example, you can see the ball bend through the air off corners / crosses etc. This is the best release yet, huge improvements over FM18.

*Inb4 someone says something about playing this since FM1972' and hates everything about FM19 and are upset because their 18th tier striker from the town of Dedham doesn't have 20 pace* 

Cheers
Same shit except this time its purple.

I will only compare this to its predecessor - Football Manager 2018, a game I played for like 160 hours and hated every minute of it.

FM19 keeps the "futuristic" complicated interface that makes it hard to see the simple stuff, but improved it massively. It solved most of the issues I had with FM18 - like the fact that compared to FM17, you had to go to a separate menu for opposition instructions rather than being the first thing you see before a game. They fixed that and I am so happy! 

The 3d match engine is WAY better. Regen faces seem better, but you will still need to install a mod pack to fix them and make them actually good. 

What I love is the new tactics system - it will actually create a tactic for you based on a preferred playstyle.

The training system is so much more complicated, which means it will work better than previous version once you completely understand it.

Also, FM19 beta seems to work quicker than FM18 full version(less lag - playing on a high-end computer, btw. No need to play down my specs and say that's why FM18 was lagging - it was not, unless an 8th gen 8086k paired with a 1080Ti and 32GB of Ram are not enough for it.)

For now, I like it better than FM18, but still prefer my simplistic FM17 save. Great buy tho! 
PS: Remember it's still beta. It will improve massively over time.

So far looks good. Definitely the best FM in ages (in terms of improvements.)

TLDR Version:
By far the best version of the game I have played in ages. The immersion level is immense, The UI is way better than FM18. The game smoothly on my 8 year old Windows machine and my 2014 model Macbook. The tactical creator has been revamped with visual indicators that actually tell you why there is a big gap between attack and defence. The tactical presets help the noob player + the veteran player who understands the Team Instructions is just gonna pick it and race ahead.  New set piece instructions. The match engine is an improvement over FM18, though i still think there are some improvements that can be made. Eden Hazard plays like Eden Hazard in real life.


Training is very immersive, with more control. Tactics and training are linked, you can actually see the style of play work.Scouting what a change, more helpful scouting centre. And lets not forget the small little QOL changes in the view, like tab reordering and separators for custom views. 

Negatives: Collision physics not in the game, which is disappoininting was hoping it would make it. The graphics engine looks good, animations still need a bit of work, some iffy animations that can be improved. 

Where FM18 was 5/10 for me, FM19 is a heavy 8/10. I would definitely recommend this game to any diehard FM fan. If you want great graphics, play FIFA. If you want an immersive all action game that makes you feel like a manager on the sidelines, FM19 is the best version to date
